programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The Landrys race to tag out at the end of the season, but they have company, as RJ and Jay Paul invade their territory looking to tag out themselves.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: A mid-winter melt threatens to derail Tom's season. Eustace masters gravity to keep the water flowing at home, while Jason and Mary make a move to feed their growing family. Morgan and Margaret top off a major project and Mike cashes in on a rare find.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A team travels to Germany and Poland to investigate a possible connection between the UFO phenomenon and the Third Reich.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle go treasure hunting in Virginia, in search of bargains to stock their new shop.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day explore Sussex, where they encounter Mods and Rockers, a haunted hotel, What the Butler Saw machines, a medieval festival and a chilli-eating contest.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John and Simon visit Warwickshire, where they go foraging in the woods, and experience military training from the First World War.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1900s meat slicer and a 1950s stamp vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works on a 1940s dog-tag maker, and the team restores a toy horse from the 1950s to its former glory.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating the reasons behind Nasa's denials of UFO accounts and why the organisation has taken measures to prevent its astronauts from telling their stories.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating beliefs held by some experts that many atmospheric light shows are actually caused by extraterrestrials.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries, beginning with a rock bearing a cryptic design that was discovered in Roswell, New Mexico, in 2004.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: An examination of what ufology calls 'trace cases', where physical material from a strange encounter is analysed to determine if it is evidence of an alien contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists delve into the stories of people who claim to have mingled with extraterrestrial beings while they were on the brink of death.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Things get physical between Dan and Dave when the desert heat sets tempers on edge, while Ivy plays it cool bidding on a high-risk locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Mary enter into an unusual alliance when the gang hits Koreatown, and Brandi steps into a classic 1980s movie when Jarrod finds a Tron costume.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A Santa Ana auction has the buyers hoping for a high-class score, while Jarrod and Ivy battle between buying sprees leaving the other bidders reeling.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope auctions in the California college town of Rancho Dominguez will land them big money. Mary decides to explore her mean side, while Darrell and Brandon look for more bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers struggle in Santa Ana and head to an auction in Hawaiian Gardens looking for more success. Mary tries to stay within budget and new competition arrives.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for big bucks in Moreno Valley, Dave and Ivy fight over a pair of units and Maverick struggles to find a good unit at a fair price.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to downtown Los Angeles where Darrell and Brandon clash as they try to get stock for their store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Lock, Stock and One Smoking Darrell
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon get more than they bargained for when a locker find ends up landing them in court.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. All hell breaks loose when Ashley puts a rare Olympic torch from Seth's personal collection up for sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley faces the consequences of her rash decision, Seth takes a ride in a hovercraft and Les does business with Muhammad Ali Jr.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The family decides to hold a father-daughter sales competition after Ashley steals a deal from right under Les's nose.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les challenges Seth to sell all the new items within a week after he learns that his son has spent thousands of dollars at a sports card auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have to break some bad news to the staff of one of their stores, while Rene tries to dominate his rivals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The latest round of auctions prompts a career-changing bid from Ivy, while Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store is mired in gossip.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The captains begin to feel the pressure with just four weeks of the fishing season remaining, as the FV-Tuna.com boat tries to hold on to its lead.

programme.title: Inside Area 51's Secrets
programme.desc: Underground tunnels, hidden enemy aircraft, secret government UFO files... After years of silence, Area 51 insiders spill their secrets for the first time and reveal what's really been going on inside the most secretive place on Earth..

programme.title: The Great UFO Conspiracy
programme.desc: According to a 2012 survey, more people in the UK believe in the existence of aliens than in God, and more than a quarter of people think that evidence of UFOs has been covered up by the government. In this documentary, writer and comedian Dan Schreiber sets out to track down those behind the current ET conspiracy theories, meeting some of the biggest voices in the UFO community in an attempt to find out why so many people are captivated by extraterrestrial mysteries.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: An examination of what ufology calls 'trace cases', where physical material from a strange encounter is analysed to determine if it is evidence of an alien contact.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman and Nish Kumar. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended version of the quiz in which Jason Manford, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh join regular participant Alan Davies to vie for points awarded for interesting - if not always correct - answers. In a Christmas-themed edition, the panellists learn the best way to wrap an awkwardly shaped present and get wine stains out of a carpet.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The teams take on one of the steepest courses in Red Bull Soapbox Race history in Lithuania. Will the soapboxes cope with the water jump and savage bone-rattler?.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Africa on a mission to find the definitive source of the Nile, the world's longest river, which spans more than 4,000 miles. The trio believe they can do a better job than explorers who claim to have discovered the waterway's starting point by travelling further and faster than previous efforts - but the only tools at their disposal are determination, ingenuity and three ageing estate cars.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Sixty teams take on a very quick course down Windhaven Parkway in Fort Worth. Who will triumph in the Lone Star State?.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman and Nish Kumar. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Thomas grapples grumpily with some awkward hand-wear, Sian Gibson seems to find proof that she may be psychic and Iain Stirling shows some tasty shortbread who's boss.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Archive footage and personal testimony exploring the early advances made by Germany, Italy and the USSR.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of becoming a steam locomotive fireman on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she fires-up NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The murder of Amir Aziz, a prominent anti-fundamentalist Muslim, drags the Lyell team into the murky world of hate-crime and counter-terrorism. Initially thought to be the work of a EDL member whose son was killed by the Taliban, the team begin to suspect the killing is connected to Sarah Begovic, a young woman who left the UK to relocate to Syria, but who recently returned home in secret with her six-month-old son. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Lintern.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh and Penny desperately seek a kidney donor to save Jim's life, Charlie is pursued by an obsessive fan, while Matt and Ajax track down a thief with eyes on their farm.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh's estranged wife arrives from Las Vegas and creates chaos for Penny and his family. Charlie and Matt teach Hayley a lesson about love, lust and the need to forgive.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sisters Sharon and Tracey's lives are changed for ever when their husbands leave for work and never return. First episode of the popular comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane discovers that Jack's father is taking her to court to gain custody, and Tricia attempts to matchmake Chrissie and Carlos, with disastrous results. Connie passes off Zubin's plans for the future of the hospital as her own ideas and Donna confesses that she's been sleeping in the relatives' room.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As all attempts to locate Abi Nixon prove fruitless, Sam begins to panic - could her daughter have been abducted, committed suicide or even faked her own death? Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's looking for a babysitter, Grant's hiding something inedible in the fridge and Ian wants to inject some drama into the season.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant's Boxing Day surprise doesn't have quite the effect he'd planned. Sharon hears Grant has arranged their wedding for today and is furious. Michelle is fed up with Vicki's doll.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is looking forward to the pitter-patter of tiny feet - despite the fact that daughter Judith is not even pregnant.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The circus brings death to Kembleford when a clown is murdered, and Father Brown hunts the killer while trying to determine why a parishioner has agreed to marry the sinister wizard Welkin. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A fashion show takes a chilling turn when young model Zoe Mackay is strangled just moments after leaving the catwalk, and while the crew and other models come under suspicion, they all have watertight alibis. To make matters worse, there are no witnesses or DNA evidence, the only clue being a single stocking clasped in the victim's hand. What does it mean - and how was her killer able to strike without being spotted? Meanwhile, Florence tries to help Humphrey improve his social skills with the opposite sex, and JP recognises one of the models as a school crush on at school. But will she remember him?.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ex-convict is found murdered in his home and suspicion immediately lands on a recently released child killer. Nikki and the Lyell team are introduced to forensic psychologist Sasha Blackburn, who works closely with those released from prison on licence, as both the victim and one of the suspects are clients of hers. The investigators soon learn that it is not just the minds of these young men that are fragile, but their freedom is too. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, guest starring Lyndsey Marshal and Niamh Cusack.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: What Would Be Your Miracle?
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the stories of people whose lives are being transformed by modern medicine, and follows them as they make their wildest dreams come true. In the opening episode, Emma meets Adele and Ashley from Aberdare, Wales, who are desperate to see their son Garin, who has cerebral palsy, walk for the first time. Now, thanks to surgery in America, there's every chance their dream could come true. And if it does, Garin has one further dream - to play football. Plus, the story of Lancashire woman Andrea, who has been deaf since childhood but is now also going blind. Will a cochlear implant allow her to hear for the first time in decades?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under £15.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the apparent suicide of a solicitor rumoured to have been stealing money from clients. When rival lawyer Otto Benham is later found murdered in a bizarre manner, the detectives begin to suspect the two deaths may be related. Mystery, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Barry Jackson, James Weber Brown and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns (2001)
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.

credits.actor: a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: The Santa Clause (1994)
programme.desc: A grumpy divorced father faces a dilemma one Christmas Eve after accidentally startling Santa and causing him to fall to his death. The guilty man's only option is to put on the red suit, jump into the sleigh and finish the round himself, much to his son's delight. Fantasy comedy, starring Tim Allen, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Eric Lloyd and David Krumholtz.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Anton Du Beke, Alistair McGowan, Sarah-Jane Crawford and Adrian Edmondson pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: As the locals prepare for Christmas Day, Leyla's hopes are raised, Rhona feels guilty about leaving, and Kim has a proposal for Marlon.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nick and Sarah unveil the refurbished factory to the staff, keeping quiet about Derek's change of heart, while Sean reveals to an appalled Fiz that Jade is living on the streets. Rita tells Gemma she has arranged to visit Mavis over Christmas, despite the fact she has no plans to go anywhere. Emma and Seb become a couple, but will Alina ruin their romance?.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin finds out about the festive ingredients to be found in Cheshire's Delamere Forest, and Ben Fogle is at Castle Howard in North Yorkshire - one of the grand settings of ITV's Victoria - to help with the renovation of its gold dome. There is also one last visit to Yorkshire Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as the farm prepares for winter and her children get ready for Christmas.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary lies to Maria that Derek ran into financial trouble, so he swooped in to save the factory and the workers' jobs. Later, he locks a tied-up Derek in the furniture shop overnight, determined to make sure he misses his flight to Florida with his kids. Fiz and Tyrone find Jade on Victoria Street and drag her back to No 9 and, while Rita decorates her tree alone, Emma informs Seb that Alina came looking for him.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Christmas Road Trip - Three Unwise Men
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix reconvene after their European travels to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer in the way of culture, cuisine and adventure. The trio journey through the Agafay desert by camel, on through the mountains and end up deep in Marrakesh's marketplace and souks, with their trip culminating in a festive feast inspired by their travels, the people they have met and the experiences they have had.

programme.title: Gremlins (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.

programme.title: Big Narstie's Big Christmas
programme.desc: Big Narstie gets us all festive for his Christmas extravaganza, in which he teaches us how to cook a turkey, wrap a present and how to have a big Narstie Christmas.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Images of Mercury reveal spider-like formations on its surface which may be an odd geological formation or something more ominous.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory in time for Christmas. Among the items is a Victorian version of a jukebox called a Polyphon, that has rusted into silence. It moves sisters Ann and Kathryn to tears when they hear it play the family's favourite carol for the first time in decades.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The comedian, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Andy Parsons and Ed Byrne, oversees a clash between The Chase from Nuneaton and The Duke of Cambridge from Battersea.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Road-based cameras provide a convincing case for why two wheels are better than one, and traffic police face weird and wacky trouble.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road rage incidents in which drivers transformed highways into their own personal fight clubs. Plus, amateur wheel stunts that shun health and safety.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado smashes into 40 houses, a massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a truck crashes into a bridge resulting in a collapse, and a drag boat crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a train accident that led to huge explosions, a wall collapsing on top of firefighters, planes colliding on an aircraft carrier, a race-car crash and a sinking pier.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics help a man with a rare convertible that needs repairing.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Cruise ship the Norwegian Epic, and how a state-of-the-art navigation system keeps the enormous vessel on course.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Enormous cargo ship the North Star, which holds 600 storage containers and carries goods to and from Alaska.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The crew of luxurious cruise liner Le Boreal braves ferocious weather conditions in Antarctica during its maiden voyage.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Supertanker Maersk Peregrino undergoes a transformation, becoming a floating oil production, storage and off-loading vessel - but its final journey to the oil fields may yet prove troublesome.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The Umiak I, the world's most powerful ice-breaking carrier, and how it delivers supplies to a remote Canadian nickel factory and returns cargo worth more than £63million to the mainland.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: A weapons test aboard the guided missile destroyer USS Gravely takes a turn for the worse, and those who made it through the training drills are revealed.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the Beluga Bremen, the world's first multi-purpose heavy-lift cargo carrier.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look inside the Viking Longship Gefjon, a narrow cruiser that fits through tight locks, battles nasty weather and glides past stunning scenery, travelling from Budapest to Amsterdam.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: The crew of the Regal Princess, Princess Cruises' largest ship, faces narrow channels, shifting waters, shallow harbours, and transport vehicles.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: The MS Koningsdam, a Dutch cruise ship operated by Holland America Line, the first of its Pinnacle-class vessels.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look at the Viking Star's Scandinavian decor, delicious food and beautiful route. It embarks from Spain going through Europe and completes its journey in Norway.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A look at life on board the Marina, Oceania Cruises' largest ship, which makes a 12-day, five port voyage. Its mobility lets it glide through narrow channels, steer into tight ports and carry 1,200 passengers.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: A crew of 2,200 on the Symphony of the Seas tends to more than 5,500 passengers as they sail to ports in France and Italy. As of 2019 it is the largest passenger ship in the world by gross tonnage.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: Deadliest Catch: Scariest Moments at Sea
programme.desc: Compelling compilation of life and death on the high seas; showcasing some of the world's most dangerous fisheries including Bering Sea crab fishing and offshore lobster fishing..

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Belgium on a continental buying adventure. He visits the flea market in Tongeren and meets a renowned dealer who lives in a huge chateau.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve heads to the Top End where a monsoon has swept away roads and created an inland sea. Later, a Perth heavy haulage crew moves a huge pedestrian bridge.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: To help celebrate Canada's 150th birthday, the Canadian Pacific Railway takes a perfectly restored, vintage train on an epic journey from coast to coast.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The casting of bells for cathedrals, and how the environment is cleaned up after large, natural storms.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of tyres made by the Titan Corporation, espresso coffee and how diamonds are cut.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna deal with the impact obesity can have on fertility, and excess hair caused by polycystic ovaries. There is also advice for a man concerned about the size of his chest.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Exploring the mind of an obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the often confused workings of the criminal psyche.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Diane Cunningham is found murdered, the only clues are several receipts. Security footage reveals a prime suspect, but not everything is quite as it seems.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau investigates the activities of a Croatian terrorist group believed to have gunned down opponents and eliminated others with parcel bombs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team springs into action when a dog and her nine puppies need rescuing from a storm drain before the rain arrives.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eternal bridesmaid Brittany, now the bride, wants to 'drop it low' in a dress. Erika plans to wear her old wedding dress down the aisle - with a different fiance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Seattle-based punk rocker Brian Barton, guitarist with As Fate Would Have It. The 25-year-old vanished in March 2005, after a bout of depression during which he left the band, broke up with his fiancee and cut ties with his closest friends.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Roxanne Paltauf, who vanished from a motel in Austin Texas in July 2006 after an argument with her boyfriend. After searching 10 acres for the 18-year-old's remains, police came up empty-handed.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of Patti Adkins who vanished in July 2001, shortly after leaving her shift at a Honda factory in Ohio. A police investigation revealed the 29-year-old single mother was making plans for a trip with a mystery boyfriend, but he has never been identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the 'bad guys' were after him.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 16-year-old Molly Bish, who vanished minutes after reporting for her summer job as a lifeguard in June 2000. Her body was found three years later after the largest search in the history of Massachusetts.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA team embarks upon the huge task of removing birds from a live crime scene. Plus, Debbie Michelson makes an intervention into a family overrun with dogs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A case of neglect turns into a stand-off when investigators discover horses with shocking injuries. Plus, the team responds to a call to save a trapped dog.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators find themselves tackling one of their biggest ever hoarding cases when they uncover over 120 cats living inside a house in terrible conditions.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA's cruelty investigators are called to an affluent suburb in the Houston area to rescue horses from a property. However, for some animals, help has come too late.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A cruelty investigator is responding to a call from the sheriff's department. A pony has been dragged down a road, leaving it crippled with pain.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: A Baby in a Shoe Box
programme.desc: In an extended episode, Chris Jacobs examines why a baby was left in a box near an Ohio petrol station after being born. Lisa Joyner makes a shocking discovery as she seeks a woman's biological mother.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Since meeting at a bariatric rehab centre in 2006, Lee and Rena's weight has skyrocketed. The couple are now taking a second attempt to save their lives.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Born with Three Arms: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The story of a two-year-old born with an extra arm growing out of his back, and his parents struggle to decide whether to have it surgically removed.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Giant Man & Tiny Wife: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man who is over seven feet tall and his wife, who is under five feet, discuss their difficulty conceiving. Plus, the story of a woman who often falls asleep for up to a month.
